properties.Name: PremiumFactor
properties.Description:
The individual factors considered when computing premium.

Ex:
- Age
- Expense Factor
- Health
- Interest Factor
- Lifestyle
- Occupation
- Sex

where:
AGE
Age is a key component of computing mortality. 

EXPENSE FACTOR
Each premium must carry a proportionate share of the  operating costs of the  insurer. HEALTH The  health of the  applicant is a primary consideration when assessing a premium. 

INTEREST FACTOR 
The  insurer makes two assumptions regarding interest:
   1) A specific net rate of interest will be earned on all its investments.
   2) One full year of interest will be earned by each premium policyowner pay.

LIFESTYLE
The  lifestyle of the  applicant may directly affect the  premium. 

OCCUPATION
Hazardous occupations pose a greater risk to the  insured and thus is reflected in a higher premium. 

SEX 
The  sex of the  applicant has a direct bearing on mortality.

Women live 5-6 years longer than men and their lower premiums is a reflection of this.

Columns.Name: PremiumFactorId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Premium Factor.

Columns.Name: PremiumFactorName
Columns.Description: The name of a Premium Factor.

Columns.Name: PremiumFactorDescription
Columns.Description: The description of a Premium Factor.
